poller

Class GmailPoller

  • java.lang.Object
    • poller.GmailPoller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, Poller

    public class GmailPoller
extends java.lang.Object
implements Poller
    Uses the Gmail API to retrieve new emails and add them to a queue that lets them be processed.
    Since:
    2016-07-11

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GmailPoller(RawDataQueue rawQueue, java.lang.String userAuthCode)
      Constructor that initializes some fields and starts up a Gmail service.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GmailPoller

        public GmailPoller(RawDataQueue rawQueue,
                   java.lang.String userAuthCode)
        Constructor that initializes some fields and starts up a Gmail service.
        Parameters:
        rawQueue - This queue contains the raw text extracted from various pollers that need to get processed.
        userAuthCode - Authentication code received from the login service.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Runs the poller on a loop.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • poll

        public void poll()
        Gets a list of emails and checks to see if the have been processed. If they have not yet been, then it extracts the raw text and creates a RawData object that is pushed to the RawDataQueue.
        Specified by:
        poll in interface Poller

      • getTimeStamp

        public java.lang.String getTimeStamp(java.lang.String messageId)
                              throws java.io.IOException,
                                     MessagingException
        Gets the date and time of a message and parses it into a simper form.
        Parameters:
        messageId - The ID of the message that's date should be returned.
        Returns:
        The date of the email in the form of yyyy/MM/dd, e.g.: 2016/07/30
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        javax.mail.MessagingException
        MessagingException

        Parameters:

                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                  MessagingException
        Get a mime version of a message that has already been retrieved as described by the JavaMail API.
        Parameters:
        message - The message that needs to be retrieved.
        Returns:

                          MessagingException
        Extract the text from and email and parse it as an RawData object.
        Parameters:
        messageId - The ID of the message that should be retrieved.
        Returns:
        Object that contains the details of the email or null if no data is found.
